name: df-rmo
params: setvar s0, class c0, wff w0
body: |- wb(wrmo(s0, c0, w0), wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
comment: Define restricted "at most one". Note: This notation is most often used to express that ` ph ` holds for at most one element of a given class ` A ` . For this reading ` F/_ x A ` is required, though, for example, asserted when ` x ` and ` A ` are disjoint. Should instead ` A ` depend on ` x ` , you rather assert at most one ` x ` fulfilling ` ph ` happens to be contained in the corresponding ` A ( x ) ` . This interpretation is rarely needed (see also ~ df-ral ). (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2017.)
